name: Crispy Baked Salmon Nuggets
description: The irresistible bite-size crispy salmon coated with panko breadcrumbs and baked until golden! No mess & freezer-friendly. Enjoy with tartar sauce or ketchup with a squeeze of fresh lemon juice. And perfect for lunch boxes too!

video.name: How to Make Crispy Salmon (Recipe) ÈÆ≠„Éï„É©„Ç§„ÅÆ‰Ωú„ÇäÊñπÔºà„É¨„Ç∑„ÉîÔºâ
video.description:
Baked tender and moist salmon wrapped with a layer of crispy panko shell, dip in tartar sauce or ketchup to enjoy.

For the complete recipe with step-by-step pictures: http://justonecookbook.com/recipes/crispy-salmon/

Ingredients:
1 cup panko
1 Tbsp. olive oil
1/2 tsp. garlic powder (or 3 clove garlic, minced)
1/2 tsp. dry thyme or any herb(s) of your choice
1 lb. (450 g) skinless salmon fillet
Salt
Freshly ground black pepper
1/4 cup all-purpose flour
1 egg

Dipping Sauce
Homemade tartar sauce (Recipe: http://justonecookbook.com/how-to/tartar-sauce-recipe/)
Ketchup


Music courtesy of Audio Network: "Always Summer"

------------------------------------------------------------------------

Check out my blog: http://justonecookbook.com/

-----------------------------------------------------------------------
‚ùÄ Follow Just One Cookbook ‚ùÄ

recipeIngredient: ¬Ω tsp garlic powder ((or 3 cloves garlic, minced))
¬Ω tsp dried thyme ((or any herb of your choice))
1 lb skinless salmon fillet ((ask a fishmonger to skin the salmon fillet for you))
1  large egg (50 g each w/o shell)

recipeInstructions.text: Gather all the ingredients. If your salmon still has the skin on, skin the salmon fillet.
recipeInstructions.name: Gather all the ingredients. If your salmon still has the skin on, skin the salmon fillet.

recipeInstructions.text: Adjust an oven rack to the middle position and preheat the oven to 400¬∞F (200¬∞C). For a convection oven, reduce cooking temperature by 25¬∫F (15¬∫C). Line a rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper.
recipeInstructions.name: Adjust an oven rack to the middle position and preheat the oven to 400¬∞F (200¬∞C). For a convection oven, reduce cooking temperature by 25¬∫F (15¬∫C). Line a rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper.

recipeInstructions.text: Combine 1 cup panko (Japanese breadcrumbs), 1 Tbsp extra virgin olive oil, ¬Ω tsp garlic powder, and ¬Ω tsp dried thyme in a frying pan and toast over medium heat until golden brown. Transfer browned panko into a shallow dish and allow to cool.
recipeInstructions.name: Combine 1 cup panko (Japanese breadcrumbs), 1 Tbsp extra virgin olive oil, ¬Ω tsp garlic powder, and ¬Ω tsp dried thyme in a frying pan and toast over medium heat until golden brown. Transfer browned panko into a shallow dish and allow to cool.

recipeInstructions.text: Cut 1 lb skinless salmon fillet into blocks 2 inches (5 cm) wide, then cut diagonally into about ¬Ω‚Äìinch (1.3-cm) slices. Sprinkle Diamond Crystal kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper on both sides of the salmon.
recipeInstructions.name: Cut 1 lb skinless salmon fillet into blocks 2 inches (5 cm) wide, then cut diagonally into about ¬Ω‚Äìinch (1.3-cm) slices. Sprinkle Diamond Crystal kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper on both sides of the salmon.

recipeInstructions.text: In a shallow dish, add ¬º cup all-purpose flour (plain flour). In another shallow dish, whisk 1 large egg (50 g each w/o shell). Dredge each salmon piece in the flour to coat completely, pat off the excess flour. Then, dip into the egg and finally coat with the toasted panko. Press on the panko flakes to make sure they adhere to the salmon.
recipeInstructions.name: In a shallow dish, add ¬º cup all-purpose flour (plain flour). In another shallow dish, whisk 1 large egg (50 g each w/o shell). Dredge each salmon piece in the flour to coat completely, pat off the excess flour. Then, dip into the egg and finally coat with the toasted panko. Press on the panko flakes to make sure they adhere to the salmon.

recipeInstructions.text: Place the salmon pieces on the prepared baking sheet. Bake at 400¬∞F (200¬∞C) until the salmon is just cooked through, about 15‚Äì20 minutes (check at 15 minutes). Serve with ketchup or Homemade Tartar Sauce.
recipeInstructions.name: Place the salmon pieces on the prepared baking sheet. Bake at 400¬∞F (200¬∞C) until the salmon is just cooked through, about 15‚Äì20 minutes (check at 15 minutes). Serve with ketchup or Homemade Tartar Sauce.

itemListElement.text: You can keep the leftovers in an airtight container and store in the refrigerator for up to 3 days or in a freezer for a month.
itemListElement.name: You can keep the leftovers in an airtight container and store in the refrigerator for up to 3 days or in a freezer for a month.

review.reviewBody: ‚ÄûLeftovers‚Äú? I don‚Äòt know what you mean‚Ä¶ üòÇ

Loved it! Nice Sunday lunch with a salad bowl and a glass of dry Riesling. 

Changed thyme for powdered ginger and powdered onion and served with homemade lemon zest/garlic/ciboulette mayonnaise. Done 15 min in the oven and grilled another 3 minutes for a beautiful colour and nice crisp. 

Thanks Namiko for all your recipes, I follow and make your recipes since long time but never dared to comment before...

Regards from a sunny South America. 
Jaime

WOW Nami these are SO GOOD for how simple the recipe is (I do feel the dried thyme is the best ingredient here to not skip, as it imparts delicious herb flavor). I have never had salmon breaded before as it does not seem to be a popular way to cook it here in the USA. This recipe was just amazing with your homemade tartar sauce recipe, and very easy to make. I am certain I'll be making this again!

And yes, it really proves that there's no need to fry. It is just as crispy and delightful as fried. It's less oily and has a lighter texture due to that.
Made these today for football Sunday and dipped them in a curry mayo - YUM! These will definitely become a game day staple for us!!

This is one of my favorite go-to recipes I make it every couple of weeks. Recently I bought an air fryer and tonight I tried the crispy baked salmon recipe in it. It turned out great! The salmon turned out nice and crispy, and with the air fryer I still think they are relatively guilt free. I will make these nuggets over and over.
These were very good. But next time I will cook less time as I think I overcooked them a bit
